TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit JapaneseCalendar extends System.Globalization.Calendar

summary.span: 代表日本曆法。

span.span: Represents the Japanese calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日本曆法相同，也就是所謂的 」 曆法行事曆，運作方式完全一樣的西曆，除了在年份及紀元不同。The Japanese calendar, which is also known as the Wareki calendar, works exactly like the Gregorian calendar, except that the year and era are different. > [!NOTE] > 如需有關使用資訊類別和其他的曆法類別在.NET 中的，請參閱 < [ 使用行事曆](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the class and the other calendar classes in .NET, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 日本曆法會辨識為每個皇帝 reign 一個紀元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 兩個最新的紀元為平成時代，自西曆 1989 年和 Reiwa 時代，開始在西曆 2019 年。The two most recent eras are the Heisei era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 1989, and the Reiwa era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 2019. 紀元名稱通常會顯示前一年。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，2001年西曆年是日文的日曆年度平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 請注意，第一年的時代稱為 「 元年。 」Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，西曆 1989 年是日文的日曆年度平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. 根據預設，格式化作業，使用指定的日期和時間格式字串，例如"D"、"F"和"Y"，輸出元年，而非"1"的結果字串中。By default, formatting operations with specified date and time format strings, such as "D", "F", and "Y", output Gannen rather than "1" in the result string. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 此類別會指派數字給紀元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|紀元名稱Era Name|紀元縮寫Era Abbreviation|西曆日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |55|令和 (Reiwa)令和 (Reiwa)|令和 （R、 r）令和 (R, r)|2019 年 1，來呈現May 1, 2019 to present| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H、 h)平 (H, h)|1989 年 1 月 8日，來於 2019 年 4 月 30日日January 8, 1989 to April 30, 2019| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S，s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25 日 1989 年 1 月 7日，December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|提名 （T，t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30 日 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M，m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8 日 1912 年 7 月 29日，September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 這個類別會處理從 9 月 8 明治第 1 年 （以西曆日曆 1868 年 9 月 8，） 的日期。This class handles dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (in the Gregorian calendar, September 8, 1868). 雖然日本曆法從不陰曆到陽曆明治 6 (1873 西曆的) 中，此實作是以陽曆的行事曆為根據。Although the Japanese calendar was switched from a lunar calendar to a solar calendar in the year Meiji 6 (1873 of the Gregorian calendar), this implementation is based on the solar calendar only. 潤年，日本曆法中對應至相同潤年西曆中。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 閏年西曆中定義為一個公曆年整除的四個，除非它是整除 100。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 不過，400 所整除的公曆年是潤年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 一般年份有 365 天，閏年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 日本曆法具有 12 個月 28 至 31 天每個：The Japanese calendar has 12 months with 28 to 31 days each: |GetMonth 值GetMonth value|月份Month|英文English|一般年份中的天數Days in common years|閏年的天數Days in leap years| |--------------------|-----------|-------------|--------------------------|------------------------| |11|1 月 (Ichigatsu)1月 (Ichigatsu)|年 1 月January|3131|3131| |22|2 月 (Nigatsu)2月 (Nigatsu)|2 月February|2828|2929| |33|3 月 (Sangatsu)3月 (Sangatsu)|年 3 月March|3131|3131| |44|4 月 (Shigatsu)4月 (Shigatsu)|4 月April|3030|3030| |55|5月 (Gogatsu)5月 (Gogatsu)|5 月May|3131|3131| |66|6月 (Rokugatsu)6月 (Rokugatsu)|JuneJune|3030|3030| |77|7月 (Shichigatsu)7月 (Shichigatsu)|7 月July|3131|3131| |88|8 月 (Hachigatsu)8月 (Hachigatsu)|8 月August|3131|3131| |99|9月 (Kugatsu)9月 (Kugatsu)|9 月September|3030|3030| |1010|10 月 (Juugatsu)10月 (Juugatsu)|10 月October|3131|3131| |1111|11 月 (Juuichigatsu)11月 (Juuichigatsu)|11 月November|3030|3030| |1212|12 月 (Juunigatsu)12月 (Juunigatsu)|12 月December|3131|3131| Nigatsu，這相當於 2 月的西曆月份，有 29 天，閏年和 28。Nigatsu, which is equivalent to the Gregorian calendar month of February, has 29 days during leap years and 28 during common years. 日期年 1 月 1，2001 A.D.The date January 1, 2001 A.D. 西曆中就相當於 Ichigatsu 日本曆法的平成 13 年中的第一天。in the Gregorian calendar is equivalent to the first day of Ichigatsu in the year Heisei 13 in the Japanese calendar. 如果是日文的文化特性的現行曆法辨識前一年的紀元縮寫。If the is the current calendar of the Japanese culture, recognizes the era abbreviations in front of the year. 縮寫是單一字元不區分大小寫英文字母縮寫或單一字元漢字縮寫。The abbreviation is either the single-character case-insensitive Latin alphabet abbreviation or the single-character Kanji abbreviation. xref:System.DateTime.Parse%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType > 也將"1"或元年 （元年） 識別為第一年的紀元。xref:System.DateTime.Parse%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> also recognizes either "1" or Gannen (元年) as the first year of an era. 每個物件支援一組的行事曆。Each object supports a set of calendars. 屬性傳回的文化特性的預設月曆，屬性會傳回陣列，包含所有支援的文化特性的行事曆。The property returns the default calendar for the culture, and the property returns an array containing all the calendars supported by the culture. 若要變更所使用的行事曆，將屬性，以新。To change the calendar used by a , set the property to a new .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 產生的日期部分產生的日期不在產生的月份，產生的 year 的有效日期會受到影響。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它會變更為產生的 year 之產生的月份中最後一個有效的日期。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 產生的年份部分產生的月份超出指定的年份會受到影響。The year part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is outside the year of the specified . 產生的紀元一部分產生的 year 超出指定的紀元會受到影響。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 產生的日期時間部分維持不變，與指定。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 比方說，如果指定的月份是 Juugatsu （年 10 月），有 31 天內，指定某一天是該月份中，第 31 天和`months`為 6 時，產生的 year 是個以上的指定年份中，產生的月份是 Shigatsu （4 月） 和產生的日期為 30 天，也就是 Shigatsu （4 月） 中的最後一天。For example, if the specified month is Juugatsu (October), which has 31 days, the specified day is the 31st day of that month, and `months` is 6, the resulting year is one more than the specified year, the resulting month is Shigatsu (April), and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day in Shigatsu (April). 如果`months`是負數，產生早於指定。If `months` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 屬性傳回之值一律等於。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留的屬性`time`藉由呼叫的參數方法，如下列範例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.Calendar.AddMethods#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.calendar.addmethods/cs/add1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.Calendar.AddMethods#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.calendar.addmethods/vb/add1.vb#5)] ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會顯示數個元件的值方面日本曆法。The following code example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Japanese calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 日本曆法會辨識為每個皇帝 reign 一個紀元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 兩個最新的紀元為平成時代，自西曆 1989 年和 Reiwa 時代，開始在西曆 2019 年。The two most recent eras are the Heisei era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 1989, and the Reiwa era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 2019. 紀元名稱通常會顯示前一年。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，2001年西曆年是日文的日曆年度平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 請注意，第一年的時代稱為 「 元年。 」Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，西曆 1989 年是日文的日曆年度平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 此類別會指派數字給紀元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|紀元名稱Era Name|紀元縮寫Era Abbreviation|西曆日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |55|令和 (Reiwa)令和 (Reiwa)|令和 （R、 r）令和 (R, r)|2019 年 1，來呈現May 1, 2019 to present| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H、 h)平 (H, h)|1989 年 1 月 8 日來呈現January 8, 1989 to present| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S，s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25 日 1989 年 1 月 7日，December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|提名 （T，t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30 日 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M，m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8 日 1912 年 7 月 29日，September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 這個類別會處理從 9 月 8 年明治 1 (January 1，1868 西曆的) 中的日期。This class handles dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (January 1, 1868 of the Gregorian calendar). 雖然日本曆法從不陰曆到陽曆明治 6 (1873 西曆的) 中，此實作是以陽曆的行事曆為根據。Although the Japanese calendar was switched from a lunar calendar to a solar calendar in the year Meiji 6 (1873 of the Gregorian calendar), this implementation is based on the solar calendar only. > [!NOTE] > 在未來加入其他的紀元，應用程式可能會遇到超過預期的五個紀元的日本曆法。Should additional eras be added in the future, applications may encounter more than the expected five eras for the Japanese calendar. 應該測試您的應用程式，以確保它們會繼續運作發生這種情況;請參閱[日本曆法的紀元處理](/windows/desktop/Intl/era-handling-for-the-japanese-calendar)。Your applications should be tested to ensure that they continue to work in such an event; see [Era Handling for the Japanese Calendar](/windows/desktop/Intl/era-handling-for-the-japanese-calendar). ## Examples 下列範例顯示中包含的值屬性。The following example displays the values contained in the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 日本曆法會辨識為每個皇帝 reign 一個紀元。The Japanese calendar recognizes one era for every emperor's reign. 兩個最新的紀元為平成時代，自西曆 1989 年和 Reiwa 時代，開始在西曆 2019 年。The two most recent eras are the Heisei era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 1989, and the Reiwa era, beginning in the Gregorian calendar year 2019. 紀元名稱通常會顯示前一年。The era name is typically displayed before the year. 例如，2001年西曆年是日文的日曆年度平成 13。For example, the Gregorian calendar year 2001 is the Japanese calendar year Heisei 13. 請注意，第一年的時代稱為 「 元年。 」Note that the first year of an era is called "Gannen." 因此，西曆 1989 年是日文的日曆年度平成元年。Therefore, the Gregorian calendar year 1989 was the Japanese calendar year Heisei Gannen. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 此類別會指派數字給紀元，如下所示：This class assigns numbers to the eras as follows: |GetEra 值GetEra value|紀元名稱Era Name|紀元縮寫Era Abbreviation|西曆日期Gregorian Dates| |------------------|--------------|----------------------|---------------------| |55|令和 (Reiwa)令和 (Reiwa)|令和 （R、 r）令和 (R, r)|2019 年 1，來呈現May 1, 2019 to present| |44|平成 （平成）平成 (Heisei)|平 (H、 h)平 (H, h)|1989 年 1 月 8日，來於 2019 年 4 月 30日日January 8, 1989 to April 30, 2019| |33|昭和 (Showa)昭和 (Showa)|昭 （S，s）昭 (S, s)|1926 年 12 月 25 日 1989 年 1 月 7日，December 25, 1926 to January 7, 1989| |22|大正 (Taisho)大正 (Taisho)|提名 （T，t）大 (T, t)|1912 年 7 月 30 日 1926 年 12 月 24日，July 30, 1912 to December 24, 1926| |11|明治 （明治）明治 (Meiji)|明 （M，m）明 (M, m)|1868 年 9 月 8 日 1912 年 7 月 29日，September 8, 1868 to July 29, 1912| 一般情況下，類別支援從 9 月 8 日的日期中年份明治 1 (年 9 月 8，1868 西曆的)，也就是值的屬性。Ordinarily, the class supports dates from September 8 in the year Meiji 1 (September 8, 1868 of the Gregorian calendar), which is the value of the property. 不過，方法成功會傳回日期的紀元年 1 月 1 日至 9 月 7 明治 1 年中 (January 1，1868 透過 1868 年 9 月 7，西曆中)。However, the method successfully returns the era for dates from January 1 through September 7 in the year Meiji 1 (January 1, 1868 through September 7, 1868 in the Gregorian calendar). 早於 1868 年 1 月 1，以西曆日期，方法會擲回例外狀況。For dates earlier than January 1, 1868 in the Gregorian calendar, the method throws an exception. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示數個元件的值方面日本曆法。The following example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Japanese calendar. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet/CPP/japanesecalendar_addget.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet/CS/japanesecalendar_addget.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_AddGet/VB/japanesecalendar_addget.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 潤年，日本曆法中對應至相同潤年西曆中。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 閏年西曆中定義為一個公曆年整除的四個，除非它是整除 100。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 不過，400 所整除的公曆年是潤年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 一般年份有 365 天，閏年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 為閏日是閏年只會發生一天。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 比方說，第 29 天的 Nigatsu （二月） 是唯一的閏日。For example, the 29th day of Nigatsu (February) is the only leap day. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫最後一天的每個紀元中的五年的第二個月 （二月）。The following example calls for the last day of the second month (February) for five years in each of the eras. 目前紀元中的範例輸出會是 Reiwa 紀元。The current era in the example output is the Reiwa era. remarks.format: ## Remarks 潤年，日本曆法中對應至相同潤年西曆中。Leap years in the Japanese calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 閏年西曆中定義為一個公曆年整除的四個，除非它是整除 100。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 不過，400 所整除的公曆年是潤年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 一般年份有 365 天，閏年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 閏月是一整個月，只會發生在為閏年。A leap month is an entire month that occurs only in a leap year. 日本曆法並沒有任何閏月。The Japanese calendar does not have any leap months. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫目前紀元中的第一個五年的所有月份。The following example calls for all the months in the first five years in the current era. remarks.format: ## Remarks 所支援的最早日期類別是年 9 月 8 中, 之西元 1868，第一年的明治紀元。The earliest date supported by the class is September 8, 1868 C.E., in the first year of the Meiji era. 一般情況下，日期和時間使用的作業類別擲回例外狀況，此日期之前的日期。Ordinarily, date and time operations that use the class throw an exception for dates before this date. 不過，某些成員，例如方法，支援從 1868 年 1 月 1，透過年 9 月 7 日的日期在明治 1 年。However, some members, such as the method, support dates from January 1, 1868 through September 7 in the year Meiji 1. ## Examples 下列範例會取得曆法所支援的最早和最新日期。The following example gets the earliest and latest dates supported by the calendar. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax/CPP/japanesecalendar_minmax.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax/CS/japanesecalendar_minmax.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar_MinMax/VB/japanesecalendar_minmax.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法很有用，因為它可以將目前曆法中的任何日期轉換成的西曆日期。The method is useful because it can convert any date in the current calendar to a Gregorian calendar date. 為西曆日期，之後可用，比方說，來比較不同的行事曆中的日期，或在特定的行事曆中建立相等的日期。The Gregorian date can subsequently be used, for example, to compare dates in different calendars or create an equivalent date in a particular calendar. 因為支援多個紀元根據桃之皇帝，您應該一律呼叫這個方法，並明確指定紀元，以避免非預期的日期並讓您清楚的程式碼的意圖。Because the supports multiple eras based on the reign of the emperor, you should always call this method and explicitly specify an era to avoid an unintended date and to make the intent of your code clear. 範例會示範如何具現化，永遠為目前紀元中的日期，另一個則屬於指定的紀元。The example shows how to instantiate a date that is always in the current era and one that belongs to a specified era. ## Examples 下列範例會具現化兩個日期。The following example instantiates two dates. 第一個是一律在目前的時代中，第二年的第一天，而第二個識別 Taisho 紀元中的特定日期。The first is always the first day of the second year in the current era, while the second identifies a specific day in the Taisho era. 此範例的輸出是由平成紀元，為目前紀元所產生。The output from the example was produced with the Heisei era as the current era. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會實作 。This method implements . 因為在日本曆法年份通常少於四個位數，這個實作一律會傳回的值`year`參數。Because the year in the Japanese calendar is typically less than four digits long, this implementation always returns the value of the `year` parameter. 支援的兩位數年份或四位數年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 不過，有效的年份是通常以兩位數字 (小於 100)。However, a valid year is generally represented as two digits (less than 100). 傳遞的兩位數年份的值會導致方法將值轉換為四位數字值，根據值，表示適當的世紀。Passing a two-digit year value causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果應用程式提供四位數字值，或如果提供零或負值，擲回例外狀況。If the application supplies a four-digit value, or if it supplies zero or a negative value, throws an exception.
